title: INTERSPEECH_2007_40_abs

sentences.text: Information distillation aims to extract relevant pieces of information related to a given query from massive , possibly multilingual , audio and textual document sources .
In this paper , we present our approach for using information extraction annotations to augment document retrieval for distillation .
We take advantage of the fact that some of the distillation queries can be associated with annotation elements introduced for the NIST Automatic Content Extraction -LRB- ACE -RRB- task .

We experimentally show that using the ACE events to constrain the document set returned by an information retrieval engine significantly improves the precision at various recall rates for two different query templates .

kg2text: This paper presents an approach for using distillation queries, which can be associated with annotation elements. It introduces our approach that utilizes information extraction annotations to augment document retrieval processes. Document retrieval is essential for distillation, as Information distillation aims to extract relevant pieces of information from massive, possibly multilingual, audio and textual document sources. Furthermore, distillation queries have broader terms, including query and a given query, highlighting their role in the information retrieval landscape. The NIST Automatic Content Extraction (ACE) task introduces annotation elements that enhance the relevance of these queries. Additionally, two different query templates, which also relate to the broader term query, are improved by an information retrieval engine, ultimately facilitating the extraction of relevant information related to a given query.

The information retrieval engine plays a crucial role in improving both precision and recall rates, which are essential metrics in evaluating the effectiveness of information retrieval systems. Within the realm of content extraction, the NIST Automatic Content Extraction initiative is a specific application that falls under the broader category of Automatic Content Extraction. This initiative utilizes a given query to extract relevant information from massive, possibly multilingual, audio and textual document sources. Additionally, query templates serve as structured formats that enhance the document retrieval process, which is itself a broader term encompassing the functions of the information retrieval engine. Furthermore, both the NIST Automatic Content Extraction and ACE initiatives are encompassed within the broader framework established by the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST).
